alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall will impact portions of western Hancock, southern Van Buren, central Lee, Clark and Scotland Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 939 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from Granger to Carthage. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on area roadways, and low lying areas will result in impacts to travel. Locations impacted include... Fort Madison, Keokuk, Kahoka, Memphis, Nauvoo, Hamilton, Warsaw, Donnellson, Montrose, Wayland, Milton, Wyaconda, Cantril, Alexandria, Franklin, Rutledge, Luray, South Gorin, Granger and Niota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed. Be sure to not drive through flooded roadways. Report any water issues to local law enforecement.
